original_title: Song for the City with Music In It's Bones
overview: A personal travel log of the timeless search for meaning, purpose, and belonging in a foreign place; by way of the sounds and melodies that shape its soul. A Super-8 scrap book of impressions formed on frosty early morning commutes on Chicago's El Train, tangled with recordings of underground street buskers, retired caf√© intellectuals, street preachers, and daily commuters compose the verses for the Song for the City with Music in its Bones.
title: Song for the City with Music In It's Bones
